saturdayDeliveryLever.label: Saturday Delivery ($nn.nn USD)
saturdayDeliveryLever.name: saturdayDelivery
saturdayDeliveryLever.helper_txt: Remember to put a Saturday Delivery sticker on your packages.

directDeliverLever.label: Deliver only to receiver's address ($nn.nn USD)
directDeliverLever.name: directDeliver
directDeliverLever.helper_txt: Do not allow package to be rerouted to another location for pickup.

carbonNeutralLever.label: UPS carbon neutral (+$)
carbonNeutralLever.name: carbonNeutral
carbonNeutralLever.helper_txt: Offset the climate impact of this shipment.

codLever.label: C.O.D. (+$)
codLever.name: cod
codLever.helper_txt: UPS will collect payment at the time of delivery.

noThirdPartyLever.label: No third party pickup (+$)
noThirdPartyLever.name: noThirdParty
noThirdPartyLever.helper_txt: Release only to the person addressed on the shipment.

exchangeNotificationLever.label: Returns {Exchange/Pack and Collect} Notification (+$)
exchangeNotificationLever.name: exchangeNotification
exchangeNotificationLever.helper_txt: Be notified when goods are ready for exchange.

shipTipFormsAlert.title: Ship Tip: What can happen if I don't give a good shipment description?
shipTipFormsAlert.text:
Even with an itemized invoice, your shipment can still be delayed if general contents can't be determined by a quick scan of the label. Customs officials are much more likely to audit you package for inspection if they can't tell what's inside it, so avoid vague terms that could describe a variety of different objects. For example:

  • Say "Men's clothing" or "Tennis shoes" -- NOT "Apparel"
  • Say "Computers" or "Electronic toys" -- NOT "Electronics"
  • Say "Leather handbags" or "Saddles" -- NOT "Leather articles"
  • Say "Hand tools" or "Power tools" -- NOT "Tools"

For more examples, see How to Describe Your Shipment to Prevent Customs Delays.

intFormsFreeCirculationLever.label: Do you need to pay import duties on this shipment?
intFormsFreeCirculationLever.name: intFormsFreeCirculation
intFormsFreeCirculationLever.help_btn:
Goods originating from or imported into the European Union are in free circulation and exempt from import duties when moving within the region.

Goods entering or returning to the EU from elsewhere must be processed for import in order to be released from free circulation.

shipTipNoValueAlert.title: Ship Tip: What are documents of no commercial value?
shipTipNoValueAlert.text:
Typed, written, or printed materials with no value for replacement are generally the only items that don't require a commercial invoice for international shipping. The rules regarding what constitutes a "document" may vary slightly by country or territory, so check out import/export tool to be sure.

Find Items Classified as Documents

intFormsTotalCustomsLever.label: Is the total customs value of this shipment greater than {$2500 USD}?
intFormsTotalCustomsLever.name: intFormsTotalCustoms
intFormsTotalCustomsLever.helper_txt: Shipments from US to [Puerto Rico/Canada] valued below {$2500 USD} are not liable for international duties.

intFormsProcessElectronicallyLever.label: Ditch paper forms and process my documents electronically.
intFormsProcessElectronicallyLever.name: intFormsProcessElectronically
